龝字的基本解释

龝
qiū
古同“秋”。

龝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiū］
［《廣韻》七由切，平尤，清。］
亦作“秌1”。亦作“龝1”。
(1)禾谷熟。
(2)引申指各种作物成熟。
(3)收成；收获。
(4)破败；萧条。
(5)指一个季度，三个月的时间。
(6)秋季。
(7)指秋天成熟的庄稼。
(8)一年的时间。
(9)指某一时期、某一时刻。
(10)飞翔貌。
(11)古以五色、五行配四时，秋为金，其色白，故指白色。
(12)古以四方配四时，西为秋，因以秋指西方。参见“秋方”。
(13)古以五音配四时，商为秋，因以秋指商声。
(14)秋主肃杀，古因称与律令刑狱有关之事为秋。参见“秋曹”、“秋憲”。
(15)通“萩”。
(16)“鞦”的简化字。
(17)姓。近代有秋瑾。

龝字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【龜字部】　龝； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页1538第17
【集韻】秋，古作龝。註詳禾部四畫。

龝字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
龝字的起名意思

暂无。

Yin
Basic explanation of words
Yin
qiū
Ancient Tong "Autumn".
Yin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiū］
["Guangyun" Qiyouqie, Pingyou, Qing. ]
Also known as "秌1". Also known as "龝1".
(1) Grain is cooked.
(2) The extension refers to the maturity of various crops.
(3) Harvest; harvest.
(4) Dilapidated; Depressed.
(5) Refers to one quarter, three months.
(6) Autumn.
(7) Refers to crops that mature in autumn.
(8) The time of one year.
(9) Refers to a certain period, a certain moment.
(10) Flying appearance.
(11) In ancient times, five colors and five elements were used for four seasons. Autumn was golden, and its color was white, so it means white.
(12) In ancient times, four directions were used to match four o'clock, and the west was autumn, because autumn referred to the west. See "Autumn Fang".
(13) In ancient times, the five tones were used for four o'clock, and Shang was autumn, because autumn refers to the sound of business.
(14) The Lord of Qiu killed him, and Gu Yin called Qiu related to the law and punishment. See "Autumn Cao", "Autumn Xian".
(15) Through "Hagi".
(16) Simplified word for "autumn".
(17) Last name. There is Qiu Jin in modern times.
Yin
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 2] [Turtle Character Department] 　龝; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Page Number: Page 1538 Page 17
[Ji Yun] Autumn, ancient works. Note the four paintings in the detailed He Department.
